comment: Lots and lots of reading. Each quiz is 15 points with 3 written responses, so missing one point on a response is an automatic 93% on it. He grades pretty harshly but gives actually really good feedback and clearly explains what you missed. Only two exams, which are actually pretty easy. His class is boring though, he just lectures for 90 minutes
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: I did a hybrid class, so our work was online, but we met for lectures once a week on Thursdays. There are no essays, however there is reading material every week, some longer than others. 11 quizzes and discussions, a midterm and a final exam all online. If you do the reading you will be fine. Also, the reading material textbook is required.

comment: The professor is very funny and nice but is a very tough grader. You have lots of reading every week, that you must read and use quotes to pass.

Professor Buehrer was a real gem to have. You can tell he is enthusiastic about teaching and always tries to make the lectures enjoyable. I HIGHLY recommend going to class as he covers everything you need to know for discussions/quizzes there. No essays. Tests are open book, just dont forget to cite quotes and youll be fine! Loved having him.
